title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments: Khanvict - closer and all other tracks by Khanvict

My three recos for the thread:

* "idkwntht" by Tomberlin. Laidback tune.  
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=brY0keRWi6s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=brY0keRWi6s)
* "Passengers" by Aoife O'Donovan. Upbeat.  
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4U3FDOHGczw](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4U3FDOHGczw)
* "Survive" by Lane 8. Slow build-up, pays off two minutes in.  
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=roAvT1WxqC8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=roAvT1WxqC8)

https://youtu.be/ygk0OcgS35c
Kirtaniyas - Nitai Gauranga feat. MC Yogi

https://youtu.be/MEXZ4MeN2Ew
Jai Uttal - Jaya Jagadambe (She Who Tears Apart Thoughts)

https://youtu.be/AUeduFLrpkg
Lucky Ali Live in Dubai Expo. 

Lucky Ali, Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy and AR Rahman performed at Dubai Expo. I have watched concert videos of all of them and Lucky Ali’s performance was the best; it felt organic and lively.

[Upside Down by Jason Richardson and Luke Holland, ft. Tim Henson.  Genre: Instrumental Progressive Metal](https://open.spotify.com/track/1SIdPNc9f3ZYfphT3aiVPG?si=v2uiva5TSa6mJv-lixuxZA&utm_source=copy-link)

[King by Syncatto. Genre: Instrumental Fusion Rock](https://open.spotify.com/track/0YilIJ7IHxbnZnkF50vi2o?si=OES9lgcwQiKSJSUUJeUpNg&utm_source=copy-link)

[Lost In Yesterday by Tame Impala. Genre: Psychedelic Rock](https://open.spotify.com/track/5JWPUEov2wlX7c0jhYZpeB?si=23Rl-J_PRR-EGYx2X_r6tw&utm_source=copy-link)

Put out my first pop rap EP last month along with a music video. It's self titled, I go by sxnchay. Here's some links:

[music video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xEQA7sAOZNM)

[spotify link to ep
](https://open.spotify.com/album/3MI5BW5YhAak9dgsedpvTX?si=-Y8NBLKOQmujrABOdQTJcA)
Hope some of you guys like it.

I am a musician and interested in various music to calm the mind. At the moment I have found a lot of great Hindu music, that relaxes the mind and softens the heart - we neet it most now due to the situation in Ukraine. I just wanted to share you, if you do not mind, my selection of such a music like a peace of quiet. Those who use "Spotify", please enjoy. That is a link:  
  
My spiritual Hindu music playlist:  
  
https://open.spotify.com/playlist/3AIqePySmzCcHPSsql3iwN?si=f92841f3a16944fa
